DataElement.preferredName: Conceptual Parent Specimen Occurrence Tissue Collection Method Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The collection method used to acquire the parent specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Something from which one or more similar and separate things have developed, or to which they are attached._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Something from which one or more similar and separate things have developed, or to which they are attached.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: Something from which one or more similar and separate things have developed, or to which they are attached.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/13/17 jk created for NWU2015-06-04-Parent Spec Coll.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of tissue collection method.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cystectomy
Pelvic lymph node dissection

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to the rectum.: Device consisting of hairs or bristles set into a handle or holder, especially one that conducts current between the rotating and stationary parts of a generator or motor.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the rectum.
Device consisting of hairs or bristles set into a handle or holder, especially one that conducts current between the rotating and stationary parts of a generator or motor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to the rectum.: A tuft of material on the end of a stick for applying solutions and suspensions

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the rectum.
A tuft of material on the end of a stick for applying solutions and suspensions

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal of rectal tissue, for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: Removal of rectal tissue, for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of a group of colors with a hue between that of violet and red.: The uppermost part, side, or surface of something.: A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).: The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.

Concepts.definition: Any of a group of colors with a hue between that of violet and red.
The uppermost part, side, or surface of something.

A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).

The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between green and indigo, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 420 to 490 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation, whose hue is that of a clear daytime sky.: The uppermost part, side, or surface of something.: A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).: The sodium salt of citrate with alkalinizing activity. Upon absorption, sodium citrate dissociates into sodium cations and citrate anions; organic citrate ions are metabolized to bicarbonate ions, resulting in an increase in the plasma bicarbonate concentration, the buffering of excess hydrogen ion, the raising of blood pH, and potentially the reversal of acidosis. In addition, increases in free sodium load due to sodium citrate administration may increase intravascular blood volume, facilitating the excretion of bicarbonate compounds and an anti-urolithic effect.

Concepts.definition: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between green and indigo, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 420 to 490 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation, whose hue is that of a clear daytime sky.
The uppermost part, side, or surface of something.

A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).

The sodium salt of citrate with alkalinizing activity. Upon absorption, sodium citrate dissociates into sodium cations and citrate anions; organic citrate ions are metabolized to bicarbonate ions, resulting in an increase in the plasma bicarbonate concentration, the buffering of excess hydrogen ion, the raising of blood pH, and potentially the reversal of acidosis. In addition, increases in free sodium load due to sodium citrate administration may increase intravascular blood volume, facilitating the excretion of bicarbonate compounds and an anti-urolithic effect.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The glandular tissue of the breast.  In females, it is composed of numerous lobules with alveolar ducts and alveoli.  In males, it is composed of rudimentary glands.

Concepts.definition: The glandular tissue of the breast.  In females, it is composed of numerous lobules with alveolar ducts and alveoli.  In males, it is composed of rudimentary glands.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Trade name for an aqueous, non-toxic tissue storage reagent that rapidly permeates tissues to stabilize and protect cellular RNA.

Concepts.definition: Trade name for an aqueous, non-toxic tissue storage reagent that rapidly permeates tissues to stabilize and protect cellular RNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

Concepts.definition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pharmacokinetics

Concepts.definition: The characteristic movements of drugs within biological systems, as affected by absorption, distribution, binding, elimination, biotransformation, and excretion; particularly the rates of such movements.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.

Concepts.definition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Refers to samples that have been preserved with formalin and then embedded into a paraffin block for sectioning.

Concepts.definition: Refers to a process where a sample is preserved with formalin and then embedded into a paraffin block for sectioning.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains a coagulant, designed for the collection of serum.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains a coagulant, designed for the collection of serum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains the anti-coagulant EDTA, designed for complete blood counts and blood films.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains the anti-coagulant EDTA, designed for complete blood counts and blood films.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.

Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to a neck, or cervix, in any sense.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Of or relating to the vagina.

Concepts.definition: Relating to a neck, or cervix, in any sense.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Of or relating to the vagina.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue is that of the emerald or somewhat less yellow than that of growing grass.

Concepts.definition: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue is that of the emerald or somewhat less yellow than that of growing grass.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Voluntary cooperation of the patient in following a prescribed regimen.

Concepts.definition: Voluntary cooperation of the patient in following a prescribed regimen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The middle layer of an anticoagulated blood specimen following separation by centrifugation. It contains most of the white blood cells and platelets.

Concepts.definition: The middle layer of an anticoagulated blood specimen following separation by centrifugation. It contains most of the white blood cells and platelets.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mutagenic and carcinogenic cyclic 1,N2-propanodeoxy (Pd) DNA adduct derived from the reaction of deoxyguanosine (dG) in DNA with the environmentally widely available or endogenously produced mutagenic and carcinogenic unsaturated aldehyde acrolein (Acr) that can potentially be used as a biomarker for exposure to Acr, the formation of certain forms of cancer and the presence of oxidative stress. The formation of gamma-hydroxy-1,N(2)-propanodeoxyguanosine (g-OH-PdG) damages DNA and stimulates the formation of tumors. Also, as Acr is formed due to oxidation of certain polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs), mostly omega-3-PUFA, the lipid peroxidation-derived DNA adduct g-OH-PdG can potentially be used as a biomarker to assess the presence of oxidized PUFAs, the level of oxidative stress and the extent of oxidative DNA damage.

Concepts.definition: A mutagenic and carcinogenic cyclic 1,N2-propanodeoxy (Pd) DNA adduct derived from the reaction of deoxyguanosine (dG) in DNA with the environmentally widely available or endogenously produced mutagenic and carcinogenic unsaturated aldehyde acrolein (Acr) that can potentially be used as a biomarker for exposure to Acr, the formation of certain forms of cancer and the presence of oxidative stress. The formation of gamma-hydroxy-1,N(2)-propanodeoxyguanosine (g-OH-PdG) damages DNA and stimulates the formation of tumors. Also, as Acr is formed due to oxidation of certain polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs), mostly omega-3-PUFA, the lipid peroxidation-derived DNA adduct g-OH-PdG can potentially be used as a biomarker to assess the presence of oxidized PUFAs, the level of oxidative stress and the extent of oxidative DNA damage.

PermissibleValues.value: Endocervical swab, Pap smear, and LEEP
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Endocervical Swab Pap Smear Loop Electrosurgical Excision

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Endocervical Swab Pap Smear Loop Electrosurgical Excision
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the cervix uteri as the intended site of administration.: A tuft of material on the end of a stick for applying solutions and suspensions: A procedure in which cells are scraped from the cervix for examination under a microscope. It is used to detect cancer and changes that may lead to cancer. A Pap smear can also show conditions, such as infection or inflammation, that are not cancer.: Uses a thin, low-voltage electrified wire loop to cut out a thin layer of abnormal tissue; generally used to remove abnormal cells on the surface of the cervix.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the cervix uteri as the intended site of administration.
A tuft of material on the end of a stick for applying solutions and suspensions

A biospecimen collection and staining procedure in which secretions and superficial cells of the cervix are collected and stained with the Papanicolaou stain followed by microscopic examination to identify the presence of abnormal cells.
Uses a thin, low-voltage electrified wire loop to cut out a thin layer of abnormal tissue; generally used to remove abnormal cells on the surface of the cervix.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The material discharged from the bowel during defecation.  It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: The material discharged from the bowel during defecation.  It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Blood for Genomic DNA
Blood for Inflammatory Markers
Blood for PRO-C3 and PC3X

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
